body:
Hello,

The goal of this PR is to replace `oxc_language_server` with the two “new” language servers provided by `oxlint` and `oxfmt`, as recommended in:
https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/issues/15119

The motivation is to align with the upstream architecture and rely on the officially recommended entry points instead of using `oxc_language_server` directly.

> Change in architecture:
>     oxc_language_server should accept different tools
>     oxlint --lsp and oxfmt --lsp uses oxc_language_server with only the required tool
>     IDE is calling oxlint --lsp and oxfmt --lsp
>     oxc_language_server should be generic to support other tools too (vitest, ...)

In addition to the language server changes, this PR:
- Enables formatting through `vim.lsp.buf.format` in oxfmt
- Adds an `:LspOxlintFixAll` command to apply automatic fixes, following the official documentation:
  https://oxc.rs/docs/guide/usage/linter/automatic-fixes.html
-- Adds default configuration (commented) for Oxlint LS

I am currently using this configuration in my own projects, and it has been working very well so far.

This PR updates the oxlint configuration and adds oxfmt support in a single change. I grouped them together because the split of `oxc_language_server` made it feel more logical to handle both at once. However, I am happy to split this into two separate PRs if that is preferred.

comment_data.body: `fname` is undefined here. And what does this do, and why is it different from `root_dir`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+--- @brief
+---
+--- https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc
+--- https://oxc.rs/docs/guide/usage/formatter.html
+---
+--- `oxfmt` is a is a Prettier-compatible code formatter for JavaScript / Typescript.
+--- It can be installed via `npm`:
+---
+--- ```sh
+--- npm i -g oxfmt
+--- ```
+
+local util = require 'lspconfig.util'
+
+---@type vim.lsp.Config
+return {
+  cmd = { 'oxfmt', '--lsp' },
+  filetypes = {
+    'javascript',
+    'javascriptreact',
+    'javascript.jsx',
+    'typescript',
+    'typescriptreact',
+    'typescript.tsx',
+  },
+  workspace_required = true,
+  root_dir = function(bufnr, on_dir)
+    local fname = vim.api.nvim_buf_get_name(bufnr)
+
+    -- Oxfmt resolves configuration by walking upward and using the nearest config file
+    -- to the file being processed. We therefore compute the root directory by locating
+    -- the closest `.oxfmtrc.json` (or `package.json` fallback) above the buffer.
+    local root_markers = util.insert_package_json({ '.oxfmtrc.json' }, 'oxfmt', fname)[1]
+    on_dir(vim.fs.dirname(vim.fs.find(root_markers, { path = fname, upward = true })[1]))
+  end,
+  init_options = {
+    {
+      workspaceUri = 'file://' .. vim.fs.dirname(vim.fs.find('.git', { path = fname, upward = true })[1]),

comment_data.body:
Thanks for catching this. `fname` being undefined is an error on my side, and I’m surprised it slipped past linting.

I had to explicitly set `workspaceUri` because the language server requires it to function correctly. I’m not very familiar with LSP internals and had to dig a bit to get this working, but there’s no reason for it to differ from root_dir, that’s a mistake, and I’ll fix it.

comment_data.body:
I’m looking for advice here. It seems to me that this could make user customization harder, but I don’t see a good alternative: without correctly setting `workspaceUri`, the options won’t work.

Would it make more sense to comment this out and document it instead, so users who want to customize the options can provide a `before_init` themselves?

comment_data.body:
According to the documentation it doesn't look for `.jsonc` files (but accept jsonc _format_).

> Only .json config files are supported, but oxlint configuration files support comments (like jsonc).

[https://oxc.rs/docs/guide/usage/linter/config.html#create-a-config-file](https://oxc.rs/docs/guide/usage/linter/config.html#create-a-config-file)

title: feat(oxlint/oxfmt): adopt and fully integrate the recommended language servers
